DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator that asks whether the patient/participant has an infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Infection
ReferenceDocuments.description: Infection

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active infection or chronic infection requiring chronic suppressive antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known active infection of HCV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have severe and/or symptomatic refractory concurrent infection other than EBV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have severe infections within 4 weeks of the anticipated Cycle 1, Day 1 (including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had severe infections within 28 days prior to randomization, including but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: HCMI Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Infection history?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: crf test 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an Active uncontrolled infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have active or chronic infection requiring systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRT Text_8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient currently have an active uncontrolled infection requiring IV antibiotics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Within 4 weeks prior to randomization, does the patient have severe infection, including but not limited, to hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have severe infections within 4 weeks prior to registration including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Severe infection requiring IV antibiotics at the time of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection, including tuberculosis, requiring antibiotic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection, including tuberculosis, hepatitis B, or hepatitis C, requiring antibiotic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ongoing or active severe infection requiring IV antibiotics at time of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Infection requiring IV antibiotics at the time of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active infection, including tuberculosis (clinical evaluation that includes clinical history, physical examination and radiographic findings, and TB testing in line with local practice), hepatitis B (known positive HBV surface antigen (HBsAg) result), or hepatitis C?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have severe infections within 3 weeks prior to registration including, but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Within 4 weeks prior to study entry, does the patient have severe infection, including but not limited to, hospitalization for complications of infection, bacteremia, or severe pneumonia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known, recent EBV infection or known history of chronic, active infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient meet the HIV, Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C criteria in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient infected with HIV?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
